Package data.algorithms

Class DFAAlgorithms

java.lang.Object
data.algorithms.DFAAlgorithms
public class DFAAlgorithms extends Object
This class provides several Algorithms for deterministic finite automata.

  • Method Details

    • getEquivalentRegex

      public static Regex getEquivalentRegex(DFA dfa)
      Returns a regular expression re with L(re) = L(dfa).
      Parameters:
      dfa - the dfa for which to create an equivalent regular expression.
      Returns:
      an equivalent regular expression.

    • areEquivalent

      public static boolean areEquivalent(DFA dfa1, DFA dfa2)
      This Method returns whether or not two dfas are equivalent, meaning decide the same language
      Parameters:
      dfa1 - first dfa
      dfa2 - second dfa
      Returns:
      true if they are equivalent, false if they are not.

    • getWordAcceptedByOneRejectedByTwo

      public static String getWordAcceptedByOneRejectedByTwo(DFA dfa1, DFA dfa2) throws DFASEqualException
      Returns a word that is accepted by the DFA dfa1 but is not accepted by dfa2. This word will incidentally be of minimal size.
      Parameters:
      dfa1 - The DFA that shall accept the word
      dfa2 - The DFA that shall reject the word
      Returns:
      a word that is accepted by dfa1 and rejected by dfs2
      Throws:
      DFASEqualException - if and only if L(dfa1) is subset of L(dfa2) (or equal)

    • decidesSubsetBidirectional

      public static boolean decidesSubsetBidirectional(DFA dfa1, DFA dfa2)
      Returns whether or not L(dfa1) is a subset of L(dfa2) or L(dfa2) is subset of L(dfa1)
      Parameters:
      dfa1 - a dfa.
      dfa2 - a second dfa.
      Returns:
      true if and only if L(dfa1) is a subset of L(dfa2) or vice versa

    • decidesSubset

      public static boolean decidesSubset(DFA dfa1, DFA dfa2)
      Returns whether or not L(dfa1) is a subset of L(dfa2).
      Parameters:
      dfa1 - the dfa whose language is the designated subset.
      dfa2 - the dfa whose language is the designated containing set.
      Returns:
      true if and only if L(dfa1) is a subset of L(dfa2)

    • getComplementDFA

      public static DFA getComplementDFA(DFA dfa)
      Creates a dfa that decides the complement of the input dfa language. (Relative to the Alphabet) Be A the alphabet of the original DFA (That decides the language L) then the complement DFA will decide the Language A*\L
      Parameters:
      dfa - the dfa which language to complement
      Returns:
      the complement dfa

    • minimizedProductDFA

      public static DFA minimizedProductDFA(List<DFA> dfas)
      This method take a List of n DFAs and returns a minimized DFA for the language L(dfa1) intersect ... intersect L(dfan). Before each iteration and at the end the resulting dfas are minimized.
      Parameters:
      dfas - the list of dfas to be multiplied in order
      Returns:
      the dfa as described above

    • minimizedProductDFA

      public static DFA minimizedProductDFA(List<DFA> dfas, PDFALanguageType type)
      This method take a List of n DFAs and returns a minimized DFA for the language L(dfa1) intersect ... intersect L(dfan). Before each iteration and at the end the resulting dfas are minimized.
      Parameters:
      dfas - the list of dfas to be multiplied in order
      type - the type of accepting state generation
      Returns:
      the dfa as described above

    • productDFADifference

      public static DFA productDFADifference(DFA dfa1, DFA dfa2)
      This method returns a product dfa = dfa1 x dfa2, that decides L(dfa1) - L(dfa2)
      Parameters:
      dfa1 - the first dfa of the operation
      dfa2 - the second dfa of the operation
      Returns:
      the product dfa that decides L(dfa1) - L(dfa2)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the alphabets of the input dfas are not equal.

    • productDFAIntersect

      public static DFA productDFAIntersect(DFA dfa1, DFA dfa2)
      This method returns a product dfa = dfa1 x dfa2, that decides the union of their language
      Parameters:
      dfa1 - the first dfa of the operation
      dfa2 - the second dfa of the operation
      Returns:
      the product dfa
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the alphabets of the input dfas are not equal.

    • productDFA

      public static DFA productDFA(DFA dfa1, DFA dfa2, PDFALanguageType type)
      This method returns a product dfa = dfa1 x dfa2. The Language that is decided by the product dfa is defined by the type parameter.
      Parameters:
      dfa1 - the first dfa of the operation
      dfa2 - the second dfa of the operation
      type - defines the language of the P-DFA
      Returns:
      the product dfa
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the alphabets of the input dfas are not equal.

    • getCompleteMinimizedDFA

      public static DFA getCompleteMinimizedDFA(DFA dfa)
      This method first completes the given dfa, then minimizes it and then (if the resulting dfa is not complete) makes it complete. The resulting dfa is most likely no longer minimized.
      Parameters:
      dfa - the dfa to reduce
      Returns:
      a complete dfa that is very close to being minimized.

    • minimizeDFA

      public static DFA minimizeDFA(DFA dfa)
      This method returns a minimized equivalent DFA using the hopcroft minimization algorithm and the algorithms for removing dead and unreachable states.
      Parameters:
      dfa - the dfa to minimize
      Returns:
      a new dfa, that is minimized and equivalent to the input dfa

    • removeDeadStates

      public static DFA removeDeadStates(DFA dfa)
      This method returns a reduced equivalent DFA that has dead states removed.
      Parameters:
      dfa - the dfa that is supposed to be reduced
      Returns:
      a new equivalent dfa without dead states

    • removeUnreachableStates

      public static DFA removeUnreachableStates(DFA dfa)
      This method returns a reduced equivalent DFA that has unreachable states removed.
      Parameters:
      dfa - the dfa that is supposed to be reduced
      Returns:
      a new equivalent dfa without unreachable states

    • hopcroftMinimization

      public static Set<Set<State>> hopcroftMinimization(DFA dfa)
      This algorithm returns equivalence classes for the Myhill–Nerode equivalence relation of the input DFA.
      Parameters:
      dfa - the dfa for which equivalence classes are constructed
      Returns:
      the set of equivalence classes

    • getCompleteDFA

      public static DFA getCompleteDFA(DFA dfa, State trash)
      This method returns a complete dfa equivalent to the given dfa. It also defines an existing state as trash state. It creates and adds a trash state for this purpose except if the given dfa is complete already. The given trash state can already be in the states set. If it is the following requirements must hold: It must not have any outgoing edges except to itself. It must not be accepting.
      Parameters:
      dfa - the dfa to create a complete version for.
      trash - the designated trash state
      Returns:
      a new complete dfa
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if trash is null or it does not fulfill the requirements.

    • getCompleteDFA

      public static DFA getCompleteDFA(DFA dfa)
      This method returns a complete dfa equivalent to the given dfa. It creates and adds a trash state for this purpose except if the given dfa is complete already.
      Parameters:
      dfa - the dfa to create a complete version for.
      Returns:
      a new complete dfa
